titleStmt.title: Uppsala University Library, Gr. 28B
titleStmt.sponsor: Greek manuscripts in Sweden – a digitization and cataloguing project

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Composite manuscript with mainly epistolographic contents, in two volumes (together with Gr. 28A)

watermark.term: Coat of arms of Amsterdam; IB

watermark.note: Possibly the countermark to the aforementioned Coat of Arms watermark.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation partly in ink, partly in pencil: 226–456.

binding.p:
Inboard binding covered in stained brown calfskin. Sewn on five supports. Stuck-on endbands in brown and reddish-brown. Blue edges. Binding title on spine: CODEX MS. GRAECUS. Gold-tooled decorations on spine compartments, bands, and board edges. The same kind of tooling is found on books bound by Johan Nilsson Norman, who was active as a bookbinder in Stockholm and was employed as bookbinder to the King’s Library . Cf. Hedberg (1949–1960)
.

history.acquisition: Claes Rålamb’s library came into the hands of Charles XI King of Sweden as part of the payment of a debt. The library, including codex Ups. Gr. 28A–B, was thereafter donated to Uppsala University Library in .

msItem.title: Georgii Lacapeni et Andronici Zaridae epistulae
msItem.rubric: Ἐπιστολαὶ τοῦ Λακαπηνοῦ καὶ τοῦ Ξαρίδη ἀμοιβαῖαι

msItem.title: Epistulae ad Andronicum Zaridem
Ep. 20, ad Andronicus Zaridas
msItem.note: At the end of this letter, the scribe has indicated that Ep. 21 is to be found above (ζήτει τὴν καʹ ἐπιστολὴν πρόσθεν ἤγουν ὄπισθεν).

With interlinear glosses. Epp. 14, 16, 18, and 20 are addressed simply to Zarides in the manuscript, without indicating the forename). This could, thus, in theory, point to either of the two brothers. For the interpretation of Andronicus as addressee, cf. Tinnefeld (2000)
.

p.note:
In Q29 and Q31–32: the same
as in Q12, unit 3, i.e. in Cod. Ups. 28A. In Q30: the same
as in Q11 (unit 3). On in Q33: the same
as in Q9 (unit 2); also present in Q18 (unit 4), and in Q22–23 (unit 6).

handDesc.handNote:
Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria ( PLP
), who is the main scribe and the organizer of this volume as well as of its sister volume, Codex Upsaliensis graecus 28A. Writes in a distinct digraphic way, with one more calligraphic variant, suggestive of the Metochitesstil, and one more narrow and cursive minuscule.

decoDesc.p: Titles, initials, marginalia and a plethora of interlinear glosses in red ink. Most initials are plain or with just a small flourish. On a simple headpiece made up from a couple of lines and two trefoils.

msItem.title: Epimerismi
msItem.rubric: Γραμματικὴ τοῦ Λακαπηνοῦ ἣν εἰς τὰς ἐπιστολὰς αὐτοῦ ἐποίησε

msItem.title: De adverbis perpauca
msItem.incipit: Ἰστέον ὅτι καθ’ ὁμοιότητα τῶν ἐπιρρημάτων

msItem.title: Grammatica
Technologiae, excerpta
msItem.incipit: Ἰστέον ὅτι πλείστας λέξεις εὕροι ἄν τις σκοπῶν
msItem.explicit: εὐθὺς δὲ ἀντὶ τοῦ παρ’ αὐτίκα
msItem.note:
With lemmata in the margin. For a more detailed account with reference to corresponding passages in Hermann’s and Cramer’s editions, see Karlsson (1981)
.

msItem.title: Epimerismi
Excerpta
msItem.rubric: Ἐκ τῶν τοῦ κυροῦ Μαξίμου Πλανούδη
msItem.incipit: Φοινίκη ἡ Συρία. καὶ φοίνιξ ὁ σύρος

p.note:
In Q34:
. In Q35–38: the same as
in Q14 (i.e. in unit 3 of Cod. Ups. 28A and in unit 11, below. In Q39–40: the same as
in Q1, unit 1 of Cod. Ups. 28A.

collation.signatures:
In the upper right margin of the first recto and, a couple of times also in the lower right margin of the last verso. In red ink on βʹ; in brown ink on the following pages: γʹ
δʹ
εʹ
ϛʹ
ζʹ

handDesc.handNote: Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria. Responsible for the first few lines and the second half of the unit, as well as marginal lemmata in the quires composed for the rest by Scribe C. His initiating the text in his spruce minuscule on would seem to indicate a tutor-pupil, or supervisor-subordinate, relationship between the two scribes.

Scribe C, another collaborator of Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria, as is also evident from marginal notes by the latter, present on the same pages. The hand is a mid-fourteenth century ornate cursive minuscule, with a tendency to let the up- and downstrokes colonize the margins and the space between lines. The impression is a densely woven fabric.

decoDesc.p: Titles, initials, and marginal lemmata in red ink. Little or no flourish at all on initials.

msItem.title: Encomium in Gregorium Nazianzenum
Laudatio S. Gregorii Theologi
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ σοφωτάτου ῥήτορος κυροῦ Θεοδούλου μοναχοῦ τοῦ Μαγίστρου λόγος εἰς τὸν ἐν ἁγίοις πατράσι ἡμῶν ἀρχιεπίσκοπον Κωνσταντινουπόλεως Γρηγόριον τὸν θεολόγον

msItem.title: Formula venditionis aedium
msItem.incipit: Ἐν ὀνόματι τοῦ πατρὸς κτλ. ἡμεῖς οἱ καὶ ἄνωθεν
msItem.explicit: ἐνώπιον καὶ τῶν ὑποτεταγμένων μαρτύρων. μηνὶ ἰαννουαρίῳ ἰνδικτιῶνος ιαʹ
msItem.note:
In the upper left margin: two crosses with the accompanying text σίγνον θυγατέρος τοῦ δεῖνος, σίγνον Ἄννης τῆς συμβίου . For a similar formula in Par. gr. 2509, see Sathas (1872–1894)
.

p.note:
In Q41–48: the same as
in Q1, unit 1 of Cod. Ups. 28A (also present in Q14, unit 3).

collation.signatures: Traces of quire signatures on (lower right margin, in brown), and on (upper right margin, in red).

handDesc.handNote: Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria.

decoDesc.p: Decoration sparse: on the first page, , a title in red ink, a headpiece in the form of a single wavy line with dots and end flowers, and the only more ornamented initial, six lines in height. Otherwise, red initials are fairly plain. The triangular-shaped text ending on is accompanied by a couple of red crosses. Paragraph numbers have been added secondarily in the margins, in a pale brown ink (αʹ–ρλδʹ). No glosses.

msItem.title: Ad Angelus Stratopedarcha
msItem.rubric: Προσφωνητικὸς τῷ μεγάλῳ στρατοπεδάρχῃ τῷ Ἀγγέλω· τοῦ Μαγίστρου

msItem.title: Ad Theodorus Metochita
msItem.rubric: Προσφωνητικὸς τῷ μεγάλῳ λογοθέτῃ τῷ Μετοχίτῃ

msItem.title: Ad Niphon Patriarcha
msItem.rubric: Λόγος προσφωνητικὸς εἰς τὸν παναγιώτατον καὶ οἰκουμενικὸν πατριάρχην κυρὸν Νίφωνα

msItem.title: Epistulae
msItem.note: The letters were edited by Lars Norrmann on the basis of this manuscript.

p.note:
In Q49–50: the same
as in Q2, unit 1 of Cod. Ups. 28A.

handDesc.handNote: Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria.

decoDesc.p: Titles and plain red initials in red ink. A few reading signs in the margins, written in the same dark brown ink as the main text.

msItem.title: Laudatio regis Cypri (Hugues IV de Lusignan King of Cyprus)
msItem.note: The text was edited under the name of Thomas Magister by Lars Norrmann.

msItem.title: Epistulae
Ep. 119a, ad Alexius Apocaucus
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ αὐτοῦ τὼ παρακοιμωμένῳ κυρῷ Ἀλεξίῳ τῷ Ἀποκαύκῳ
msItem.note: The last couple of lines were first written at the bottom of the page, but the scribe must have chosen to instead add them on top of the scratched-out title of the next text in an attempt to cover the erasure of a risky reference to a deposited ruler.

msItem.title: Encomium in Matthaeus Cantacuzenus Emperor of Byzantium
msItem.incipit: Ἄλλος μὲν ἄν τις κράτιστε βασιλεῦ μεγίστην περὶ λόγους κεκτημένος ἰσχύν
msItem.explicit: μάλα κράτει τῷ σῷ ἔστ’ ἂν ὕδωρ τὲ ῥέῃ καὶ δένδρεα μακρὰ τεθήλῃ
msItem.note: Only traces remain of the erased rubric. See further the commentary to Gustav H. Karlsson’s edition of the text. The conjecture that Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria would be the author depends both on the composition and wording and on the fact that its title was camouflaged. It apparently entailed some danger to the person producing the book.

msItem.title: Encomium in Johannes VI Cantacuzenus Emperor of Byzantium
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ αῦτοῦ εἰς τὸν εὐσεβέστατον βασιλέα κυρὸν Ἰωάννην τὸν Καντακουζηνόν
msItem.explicit: μοίρας τῷ τῆς δουλείας ὑποζεύξῃς ζυγῷ, πῶς

note.p: The text breaks off abruptly at the foot of the page.

p.note:
In Q51: the same
as in Q14 (i.e. in unit 3 of Cod. Ups. 28A) and also in unit 8, above.

handDesc.handNote: Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria. The rubrics on and are also in his hand. is blank.

Scribe B, collaborator to Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria. Displays a cursive minuscule script is not altogether different from the cursive variant of the main hand. Scribe B has contributed also in quires Q9, Q13–14, and Q18 in Gr. 28A.

decoDesc.p: Some titles and initials in red ink. The greenish-brown ink which Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria used for everything on was also employed for the replacement title on .

msItem.title: Florentius
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ σοφωτάτου Νικηφόρου τοῦ Γρηγορᾶ διάλογος Φλωρέντιος ἢ Περὶ σοφίας. τὰ τοῦ διαλόγου πρόσωπα· Κριτόβουλος, Φλωρέντιος, Ξενοφάνης, Νικαγόρας, Ξενοκράτης
msItem.note: The text ends with the scholion that is put as a prelude to the dialogue in Pietro Luigi M. Leone’s edition.

msItem.title: Libanii ac Basilii epistulae mutuae XXIII
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ μεγάλου Βασιλίου καὶ τοῦ Λιβανίου πρὸς ἀλλήλους ἐπιστολαὶ αἳ καὶ ἀμοιβαῖαι καλοῦνται

msItem.title: Epistulae ad Libanius
Epp. 22, 1, 3, 5, 8, 10, 14, 16, 17, 19
msItem.note: The numbering is given according to Richard Foerster’s edition.

msItem.title: Epistulae ad Basilius Caesariensis
Epp. 2, 4, 6, 7, 9, 11, 12, 13, 15, 23, 18, 20, 21
msItem.note: Numbering according to Richard Foerster’s edition. Ep. 9 lacks a few words at the end: expl. καθ’ ἡμέραν ἀρδοίμεθα.

msItem.finalRubric: Ζήτει ἑτέραν ἐπιστολὴν ὀπίσω πρὸ τῶν δ’ φύλλων
msItem.note: All in all, the order of the mutual letters are: Ep. 22, 1–16, 23, 17–21. The final rubric at the end refers to the fact that Ep. 22 was added in a small blank space within the preceding text.

p.note:
In Q52–55: the same
as in Q19, i.e. in unit 5 of Cod. Ups. 28A. In Q56:
.

collation.signatures:
For the most part given in the lower center margin of last verso and first recto; the Gamma also in the upper right margin of the first recto: βʹ
γʹ
δʹ
εʹ

handDesc.handNote: Scribe D, collaborator to Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria, with the exception of the first title and a few lines on the last page. Writes in so-called Metochitesstil. Resembles Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria’s more calligraphic variant of writing.
Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria. He also contributed the title on and added a few lines mid-page on .

decoDesc.p: Titles, initials, and marginalia in red ink. A headpiece in red on , displaying a double frame, a wavescroll in the space left blank, and corner beads.

msItem.title: Dialogus inter Gregorius Palamas et Nicephorus Gregoras
msItem.rubric: Τοῦ Φακρασῆ κυροῦ Γεωργίου τοῦ πρωτοστράτορος Διήγησις ἐπίτομος παρόντος καὶ αὐτηκόου γεγονότος τῆς ἐπὶ τοῦ παλατίου γενομένης διαλέξεως τοῦ Θεσσαλονίκης τοῦ Παλαμᾶ καὶ φιλοσόφου Νικηφόρου τοῦ Γρηγορᾶ
msItem.incipit: Ὁρισθεὶς παρὰ τοῦ βασιλέως ἤρξατο ὁ Θεσσαλονίκης λέγειν

handDesc.handNote: Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria.

decoDesc.p: Title and one plain initial in red ink on . In the margin of there are simple binary diagrams of basic concepts.

msItem.title: Argumenta dogmatum Hesychastarum, e scriptura sacra et patribus petita
msItem.incipit: Ὅτι Ἡσαίας ὁ προφήτης προέφησε περὶ τοῦ σωτῆρος
msItem.note: The text written crosswise in the outer margin of is also part of this item. The excerpts include passages from Basilius Caesariensis, Johannes Chrysostomus, and Isidorus I Patriarch of Constantinople.

msItem.title: Index argumentorum praedictorum
msItem.incipit: Περὶ τοῦ ὅτι εἰσὶ πολλαὶ αἱ ἐνέργειαι τοῦ ἁγίου πνεύματος
msItem.explicit: μετέχεσθαι ὁ θεὸς παρὰ τῆς λογικῆς κτίσεως
msItem.note: A brief summary of the Hesychast arguments assembled on the preceding pages.

msItem.title: Excerpta patristica
msItem.rubric: Μαρτυρίαι ἁγίων, ὅτι οὐ χρὴ προσέχειν λέξεσιν ἀλλὰ πράγμασι καὶ τὸν σκοπὸν ἐξετάζειν τοῦ πρὸς τοὺς λόγους τοῦ γράφοντος
msItem.note: The excerpts include brief passages from Gregorius Nazianzenus, Athanasius Alexandrinus, Basilius Caesariensis, Cyrillus hierosolymitanus, Maximus Confessor, and Johannes Damascenus.

msItem.title: Sermo Ad Chionas Impios
Excerptum
msItem.rubric: Διάλεξις τοῦ Παλαμᾶ πρὸς τοὺς Ἰσμαηλίτας ὅτε αἰχμάλωτος ἐγένετο περὶ πίστεως ...
msItem.note: Alkibiadēs I. Sakkeliōn’s edition was not available to us for comparison. The rubrics are partly erased. All in all, the text is in rather bad shape due to wear and paper restoration.

msItem.title: Brief saying on philomathy
msItem.note: The brief saying on philomathy refers to Isocrates (Or. 1, 18), and Plato (Phaedrus; Apologia).

msItem.title: Carmina
Excerpta e cap. 5, Carmen 7
msItem.rubric: Στίχοι τοῦ Φιλῆ εῖς τοὺς λόγους τοῦ θεολόγου τοὺς ἀναγινωσκομένους

note.p: Comprises sixteen excerpts from Carmen 7, namely the following tetrastichoi according to Emmanuel Miller’ edition: No. 1, 45, 44, 41, 15, 24, 19, 38, 43 (lines 10–13), 39, 40, 11, 21, 42, 14, 16 (lines 1–8).

p.note: One leaf, , has a different height (230 mm), and has been folded in at the lower margin.

collation.formula: A quaternion pieced together from restored leaves.

handDesc.handNote: Scribe A, Philotheos Metropolitan of Selymbria.

decoDesc.p: Titles, initials, and marginalia in red ink; in some places faded and rewritten.

revisionDesc.change: Changing status from draft to published
